cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles E of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west, then turning west-southwest toward the south-central Texas coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: North of Sargent to High Island TX, including Galveston Bay (1–2 ft surge and heavy rain)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible; only a 4 % chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds. Peak sustained winds at the port likely 20–30 mph with occasional higher gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft inundation possible along Galveston Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain forecast for the upper Texas coast, including Galveston, with locally higher amounts leading to street flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated brief tornadoes possible Saturday.
